caption: Authentication Factor
description: Information on factors used to authenticate.
name: authentication factor

factor_device.description: Device used to complete the authentication request.

1.caption: SMS
1.description: A code sent to an end user's mobile device via SMS text message.

2 question.caption: Security Question
2 question.description: User answered a security question that only the user should know the answer to.

3.caption: Phone Call
3.description: System calls the user's registered phone number and requires the user to answer and provide a response.

4.caption: Biometric
4.description: Devices that verify identity based on user's physical identifiers, such as fingerprint scanners or retina scanners.

5.caption: Push Notification
5.description: Push notification sent to user's device and requires the user to acknowledge.

6.caption: Hardware Token
6.description: Physical devices that generate a code that can be used for authentication.

7.caption: OTP
7.description: Application generated a one-time password for use in authentication.

8.caption: Email
8.description: A code or link sent to a user's registered email address.

9.caption: U2F
9.description: Typically involves a hardware token which the user physically interacts with to authenticate.

10.caption: WebAuthn
10.description: Web based API allows users to register devices as factors.

11.caption: Password
11.description: Password that was previously created by the user is entered.

is_totp.description: Whether the authentication factor is a Time-based One-time Password (TOTP).

is_hotp.description: Whether the authentication factor is an HMAC-based One-time Password (HOTP).

factor_question.description: Question provided for user to answer for question based authentication factor.

factor_telephony_number.description: Phone number for a telephony based MFA request.

factor_email.description: Email that an authentication was performed with
